spell.name: Abolish Shadows

components.m: a small piece of obsidian

entries: A burst of positive energy leaps out from around you, disrupting shadows and evil spirits in the area. Incorporeal creatures, such as wraiths, ghosts, or shadows automatically take {@damage 5d6} radiant damage. If any of this spell's area intersects with an area of darkness created by a spell of 3rd level or lower, the spell that created the darkness is dispelled.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.
{@link Abolish Shadows|https://www.dmsguild.com/product/185957/Spells-of-the-Unapproachable-East}

spell.name: Acid Storm

components.m: a flask of acid worth at least 50 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: A green cloud appears in the air within range and scatters the sky with thick droplets of burning acid in a 30-foot radius, 40-foot high cylinder. Each creature in the cylinder must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 12d6} acid damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. In addition, all targets, not regarding if the creature made the save or not, are coated in acid and take {@damage 2d6} acid damage at the start of each of their turns until they take an action to remove the acid from themselves.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a slot of 7th level or higher, the initial damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Ball Lighting

components.m: handful of copper and iron pellets

entries: You create one to four spheres of concentrated lightning. You deal a total of {@damage 8d8} lightning damage, divided up among the balls as you wish. For example, you could make one ball that deals {@damage 8d8} damage, four balls that each do {@damage 2d8} damage, one ball that does {@damage 4d8} damage and two that do {@damage 2d8} damage, and so forth. While you can divide the damage dice among as many balls as you wish, up to the maximum of four, a ball cannot deal less than {@damage 1d8} damage at a time.

Each ball is 5-foot diameter sphere that hovers in the air for the duration in unoccupied spaces within range. Any creature that ends its turn within 5 feet of a ball must make a Dexterity saving throw. The creature takes the damage you designated to that particular ball on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature has disadvantage on this saving throw if it is wearing armor made of metal.

As a bonus action, you can move one or more of the balls up to 30 feet. If you ram a ball into a creature, that creature must make the saving throw against the ball's damage, and the ball stops moving that turn.

When you move a ball, you can direct it over barriers up to 5 feet tall and jump it across pits up to 10 feet wide. The ball sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the maximum number of spheres you can make with this spell increases by one for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Beltyn's Burning Blood

components.m: a drop of blood and a pinch of saltpeter

entries: You infuse a creature's blood with hot, corrosive material, causing severe pain and nausea. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 2d8} acid damage and {@damage 2d8} fire damage and is {@condition poisoned} until the end of their next turn. Even if a creature succeeds on this saving throw, they still must continue making the save at the beginning of every turn for the duration or suffer the effects of the spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the fire damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Bladebane

components.m: a drop of blood and ruby dust worth 500 gp, which is consumed

entries: You touch a weapon that deals slashing damage and give it a deadly quality against a specific type of creature: aberrations, celestials, dragons, elementals, fey, fiends, giants, monstrosities, oozes or undead. Against the chosen creature type, the bladed weapon is treated as a magic weapon with a +2 to attack and damage rolls, as well as dealing an extra {@damage 2d6} damage on a hit.

spell.name: Combust

components.m: a drop of oil and a piece of flint

entries: You cause a creature or an object to burst into flames. Make a melee spell attack against a creature or an object you can reach. If the target is a creature, it takes {@damage 3d8} fire damage on a hit and must then make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, the creature catches on fire and takes {@damage 1d8} fire damage at the start of each of its turns until the creature takes an action to put out the fire.

If the target is an inflammable object, the initial eruption of flame automatically sets the object on fire and the object takes {@damage 1d8} fire damage every round until put out or the object is destroyed.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the initial damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level after 2nd.

spell.name: Conjure Minor Undead
entries: You summon {@filter undead|bestiary|type=undead|miscellaneous=!swarm} that appear in unoccupied spaces you can see within range. You choose one of the following options for what appears:

items: One {@filter undead|bestiary|type=undead|miscellaneous=!swarm} of challenge rating 2 or lower
Two {@filter undead|bestiary|type=undead|miscellaneous=!swarm} of challenge rating 1 or lower
Four {@filter undead|bestiary|type=undead|miscellaneous=!swarm} of challenge rating 1/2 or lower
Eight {@filter undead|bestiary|type=undead|miscellaneous=!swarm} of challenge rating 1/4 or lower

entries: An undead summoned by thus spell disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or the spell ends.

The summoned creatures are friendly to you and your companions. Roll initiative for the summoned creatures as a group, which have their own turns. They obey any verbal commands that you issue to them (no action required by you). If you don't issue any commands to them, they defend themselves from hostile creatures, but otherwise take no actions.
The DM has the creatures' statistics.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using certain higher-level spell slots, you choose one of the summoning options above, and more creatures appear: twice as many with a 6th-level slot and three times as many with an 8th-level slot.

spell.name: Create Magic tattoo

components.m: tattoo inks in appropriate colors worth at least 100 gp

entries: This spell creates a single magic tattoo on a creature. The selection of tattoos is limited by the level you cast this spell at, as shown below. Inscribing a magic tattoo requires a successful ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 8+the level you cast this spell at.

A single creature ay have no more than three magic tattoos at a time. Creating multiple tattoos requires separate castings of the spell for example, creating two tattoos requires you to cast this spell two times. A successful {@spell dispel magic|PHB} spell cast on a creature can destroy one of the tattoos on a creature.
{@b Casting at 2nd to 3rd level.} If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd or 3rd level you can scribe a tattoo that creates one of the following effects:

items: Advantage on one saving throw for the duration
+1 to attack rolls for the duration

entries: {@b Casting at 4th to 6th level.} If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th, 5th, or 6th level you can scribe a tattoo that creates one of the following effects, plus all effects available at lower levels:

items: Advantage on all saving throws for the duration
+2 to all attack rolls for the duration
+5 to hit point maximum for the duration

entries: {@b Casting at 7th level or higher.} If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th, 8th or 9th level you can scribe a tattoo that creates one of the following effects, plus all effects available at lower levels:

items: Resistance to two damage types for the duration.
Immunity to a single spell or magical effect for the duration, such as a lich's life drain attack.
An effective +2 to one ability score for the duration.

spell.name: Decastave

components.m: a slender rod of duskwood

entries: You instantly call into existence a quarterstaff made of force, about 8 feet long and 2 inches in diameter. The staff lasts only as long as you keep it in your hand. If it leaves your hand or if you give it to someone else it vanishes.

You can use the {@i decastave} in combat by making a melee spell attack, doing {@damage 2d8} thunder damage on a hit. In addition, the target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, it is {@condition deafened} for the duration. The target can make the saving throw again at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. Once a creature succeeds on this saving throw, it is immune to the deafening effect of the {@i decastave} for 24 hours.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for every two slot levels above 2nd.

spell.name: Enervation

components.m: a dried plant

entries: Your touch drains the energy and life out of a creature. A creature you touch must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature gains a level of {@condition exhaustion}. If it fails the save by 5 or more, it instead gains two levels of {@condition exhaustion}. For the duration of the spell, a creature affected by this spell must make a Constitution saving throw at the beginning of each of its turns. Every time a creature fails the saving throw, it gains a level of {@condition exhaustion}. Every time it succeeds on the save, the creature loses one level of {@condition exhaustion}. The spell ends if a creature loses all its {@condition exhaustion} levels or if it succeeds on three saving throws against this spell in a row. If a creature gets to six levels of {@condition exhaustion}, it dies.
When the spell ends, all levels of {@condition exhaustion} end instantly.

spell.name: Eye of Power

components.m: a bit of bat fur

entries: You create an eye composed of glowing blue energy in a known location on the same plane of existence as you are that hovers in the air for the duration.
You mentally receive visual information from the eye, which has truesight out to 60 feet. The eye can look in every direction.

As an action, you can move the eye up to 30 feet in any direction. There is no limit to how far away from you the eye can move, but it can't enter another plane of existence. A solid barrier blocks the eye's movement, but the eye can pass through an opening as small as 1 inch in diameter.

You can also cast a spell of 3rd level or lower that does not have a range of self through the eye. The spell appears to come from the eye's location rather than yours. A spell with a range of touch can be cast if the eye is within 5 feet of the target. Casting a spell through the eye ends the spell.
An {@i eye of power} is visible and corporeal, so it can be destroyed. The eye is an object with AC 16 and 50 hit points. It uses your bonuses for saving throws.

spell.name: Fiendform

components.m: a bone from a slain fiendish creature

entries: You assume the form of a fiend for the duration. The new form can be of any fiend, such as a devil or demon, with a challenge rating equal to your level or lower. You must have seen the sort of fiend at least once. You transform into an average example of that fiend, one without any class levels or the Spellcasting trait.

Your game statistics are replaced by the statistics of the chosen fiend, though you retain your alignment and Intelligence, Wisdom and Charisma scores. You also retain all of your skill and saving throw proficiencies, in addition to gaining those of the fiend. If the fiend has the same proficiency as you and the bonus listed in its statistics is higher than yours, use the fiend's bonus in place of yours. You can't use any legendary actions or lair actions of the new form.

You assume the hit points and Hit Dice of the new form. When you revert to your normal form, you return to the number of hit points you had before you transformed. If you revert as a result of dropping to 0 hit points, any excess damage carries over to your normal form. As long as the excess damage doesn't reduce your normal form to 0 hit points, you aren't knocked {@condition unconscious}.

You can't use any special senses you have (for example, darkvision) unless your new form also has that sense. In addition, you cannot cast spells or speak. Your gear melds into your new form. You can't activate, use, wield, or otherwise benefit from any of its equipment.

spell.name: Flensing

components.m: an onion

entries: When you cast this spell, you peel layers of flesh from the target's body, causing incredible pain and trauma. Choose a creature you can see within range. It takes {@damage 6d6} necrotic damage and its hit point maximum is reduced by the same amount. At the beginning of each of your turns for the duration of the spell, the target's Charisma and Constitution scores are reduced by {@dice 1d4 + 1} each and the target takes {@damage 3d6} necrotic damage until the spell ends. As an action, the target can make a Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, the spell ends.

spell.name: Force Orb
entries: Up to four globes of pure energy strike out from your hand at targets. For each of these globes, make a ranged spell attack.

On a hit, the target takes {@damage 4d12} force damage. Hit or miss, the globes then explode in a burst of percussive sound. The target and each creature within 5 feet of where any of the globes exploded must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 2d8} thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
A creature caught in the burst of multiple globe explosions only takes the damage once.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you create one additional globe for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Ghorus Toth's Magnetism

components.m: a small lodestone

entries: You fire a brilliant blue ray at a single creature or object within range. Make a ranged spell attack. If you hit, you charge the target with an intensely powerful magical magnetic force. You can only affect objects or creatures made out of metal or creatures wearing or carrying metal armor, weapons, or gear.

The magical magnetism created by this spell creates a zone of attraction with a radius of 30 feet around the creature or object. Every metallic object entering the zone of attraction is pulled towards the magnetized object. Every round metal creatures or objects are within this zone of attraction, they must make a Strength check with a DC of 10 + your proficiency bonus + your spellcasting ability modifier. On a failure, a creature or object is pulled 10 feet towards the attracted object, or an additional 5 feet if it failed the check by 5 or more.

Creatures carrying or holding metal objects may choose to release them, in which case the items fly to the creature or object at the center, or hold onto them, in which case they are also treated as metal creatures. Unattended metal objects of 50 pounds or less in the zone of attraction fly with great force and strike the target creature or object at the center, dealing {@damage 2d6} bludgeoning damage for each object. Objects heavier than 50 pounds are simply dragged 10 feet closer per round.

Metal creatures or objects that reach the magnetized target of this spell become stuck and are considered to be {@condition grappled}, and creatures can attempt to get out of the grapple by making a Strength check contested by an ability check with your spellcasting ability modifier.

If a creature or object at least twice as heavy as the target of this spell moves into the zone of attraction, the target you chose is dragged to it instead, and the new object is the new center zone of magnetism.

spell.name: Ghorus Toth's Metal Melt

components.m: a drop of mercury

entries: You alter the properties of a metal object so that it flows like water. The metal object does not change temperature but flows as a liquid then returns to solid state once the spell ends, usually in a form resembling a puddle. To cast the spell, you must touch a metal object within your reach.
If you target an object worn or carried by a creature, that creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the spell takes effect against the object.

Armor melted by this spell does not lose its properties or AC bonus, but it takes a permanent loss to AC equal to the number of rounds the spell affected the object. Weapons melted by this spell take a cumulative penalty of -1 to their attack and damage rolls at the start of your turn for every round that the spell is in effect, and become unusable once the penalty reaches -5.

If the object is a magic item, this may render the item useless and nonfunctional, although some magical properties may remain at the DM's discretion. For example, a melted {@item rod of security|DMG} cannot be used as a weapon, although it can still transport creatures to the demiplane.

A metal construct subjected to this spell must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes {@damage 6d8} radiant damage, or half as much damage on a successful one. In addition, on a failed save, for the duration the creature is under the effect of a {@spell slow|PHB} spell.

spell.name: Greenfire
entries: You create from the ground beneath your enemies a vapor of corrosive green energy. Each creature in a 20-foot cube must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, creatures take {@damage 7d4} acid damage, plus {@damage 4d4} acid damage at the start of their next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half the initial damage and no damage at the start of its next turn.

The vapor stays for one minute, or until a strong wind (20 mph) disperses it. Any creature that enters the vapor's space for the first time on a turn or ends its turn in the vapor takes {@damage 1d4} acid damage.
You may choose to make the spell not affect natural vegetation in the area.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a slot of 4th level or higher, the initial damage increases by {@dice 2d4} for each level above 4th.

spell.name: Ilykkur's  Mantle

components.m: an uncut diamond worth at least 50 gp

entries: You encase yourself in an aura against hostile magic. For the duration, you have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects, and you gain resistance to one damage type of your choice: acid, cold, fire, lightning, thunder, or poison.

spell.name: Improved Blink
entries: At the end of each of your turns for the duration of the spell, you vanish from your current plane of existence and appear in the Ethereal Plane (the spell fails and the casting is wasted if you were already on that plane). At the start of your next turn, and when the spell ends if you are on the Ethereal Plane, you return to an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within 10 feet of the space you vanished from. If no unoccupied space is available within that range, you appear in the nearest unoccupied space (chosen at random if more than one space is equally near). You can dismiss this spell as an action.

While on the Ethereal Plane, you can see and hear the plane you originated from, which is cast in shades of gray, and you can't see anything there more than 60 feet away. You can only affect and be affected by other creatures on the Ethereal Plane. Creatures that aren't there can't perceive you or interact with you, unless they have the ability to do so.

spell.name: Improved Mage Armor

components.m: a segment of scale mail

entries: You touch a willing creature who isn't wearing armor, and a protective magical force surrounds it until the spell ends. The target's base AC becomes 15 + its Dexterity modifier. The spell ends if the target dons armor or if you dismiss the spell as an action.

spell.name: Nybor's Gentle Reminder

components.m: a stick at least one foot long

entries: This spell is often used by the Red Wizards and slave overseers to make their servants work a little faster. It inflicts a subject with sharp mental pain that makes them unable to act for a short amount of time.

When you cast this spell, the target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, it is {@condition incapacitated} until the end of your next turn, doubled over in pain. For the remaining duration, the target is subject to the {@spell bane|PHB} spell and takes a {@dice 1d4} penalty to attack rolls and saving throws.

spell.name: Nybor's Mild Admonishent

components.m: a stick at least one foot long

entries: This spell inflicts multiple creatures with sharp pain. Choose up to three creatures within 30 feet of each other to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature is {@condition stunned} for the duration. A creature can make a saving throw at the end of each of their turns for the duration of the spell, ending the stun effect on a success.
For the duration of the spell, targets who make the save are still subject to a bane spell and take a {@dice 1d4} penalty to attack rolls and saving throws until the spell ends.

spell.name: Nybor's Stern Reproof

components.m: a stick at least one foot long

entries: This spell is an even stronger version of {@spell Nybor's gentle reminder|PPSUE}, causing pain that fogs the mind and injures the body.

When you cast this spell, the target must make a Wisdom saving throw. A creature that currently has 150 hit points or less drops to 1 hit point and is {@condition stunned} for 1 round. If a creature that currently has 150 hit points or less succeeds on the save, it is {@condition incapacitated} for 1 minute. A creature {@condition incapacitated} in this way can make a Wisdom saving throw at the end of each of its turns for the duration, ending the effect on a success.
If you target a creature that currently has greater than 150 hit points, it is subject to the effects of a {@spell Nybor's gentle reminder|PPSUE} spell on a failed save, and no effect on a success.

spell.name: Nybor's Wrathful Castigation

components.m: a whip

entries: This spell causes pain so strong that it can kill a creature through the mind.

When you cast this spell, the target must make a Wisdom saving throw. A creature that currently has 100 hit points or less is {@condition stunned} for 1 round and then dies at the end of its next turn on a failed save. If a creature that currently has 100 hit points or less succeeds on the save, it is {@condition incapacitated} for 1 minute. A creature {@condition incapacitated} in this way can make a Wisdom saving throw at the end of each of its turns for the duration, ending the effect on a success. Once a creature succeeds on this save, they have disadvantage on their attack rolls and saving throws for 1 minute.
If you target a creature that currently has greater than 100 hit points, it is subject to the effects of a {@spell Nybor's mild|PPSUE} admonishment spell on a failed save, and no effect on a success.

spell.name: Recitation

components.m: your holy text

entries: You invoke your deity's blessing on your companions. You and friendly creatures within 30 feet of you gain a +2 bonus to their AC, attack rolls, and saving throws. A creature that worships the same deity as you gains a +3 bonus instead.

spell.name: Shroud of Undeath

components.m: a bit of bone dust

entries: You shroud yourself with negative energy, making nonintelligent undead perceive you as a fellow undead creature even though your appearance is unchanged. Non-intelligent undead will not attack you, while intelligent undead must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw in order to target you. If this spell is used at the same time as an illusion spell to appear undead, undead have disadvantage on their Intelligence checks to detect that your appearance is an illusion.
If you target an affected undead creature with an attack or harmful spell while this spell is in effect, that undead creature is immune to the effects of this casting of the spell for 24 hours.

You are also treated as if you are undead for the purposes of all spells and magical effects while the spell lasts. Effects such as {@i turn undead} affect you as well, and a {@i destroy undead} attempt stuns you for 1 round if you fail the saving throw.

spell.name: Simbul's Skeletal Deliquescence

components.m: a piece of a gelatinous cube

entries: You fire a ruby-red ray from your hands and attempt to dissolve a creature's bones. One creature you see within range must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature's bones and skeletal structure liquefies as the creature falls in a heap. While in this form, the creature automatically fails Strength and Dexterity saving throws, has their speed fall to 0, cannot take actions or reactions, and cannot speak. The affected creatures AC becomes 8, if it is not 8 or lower already, and the creature gains vulnerability to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage. The affected creature is immune to being {@condition prone}.

At the end of each of the creature's turns, it must make a Constitution saving throw. After failing three of these saving throws, the spell lasts for the duration. After succeeding on three of these saving throws, the creature's bones reform. The recrystallization of the bones in the subject's body causes great pain and the creature is {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn, at which point the spell ends.

spell.name: Simbul's Spell Matrix

components.m: a piece of amber worth at least 500 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You prepare a magical matrix that allows you to store one of your spells and cast it at any time you choose, without requiring an action.

In the round after you cast this spell, you can then cast a spell of 3rd level or lower to place in the matrix, using a slot and components for that spell as usual. You can only store a spell that has a casting time of 1 action, and a spell stored in a spell matrix is treated as one of your prepared spells. Placing a spell into the matrix does {@damage 1d6} force damage to you, which cannot be reduced in any way while the spell is active.

For the spell's duration, you can cast the spell placed in the matrix as a free action. This casting does not necessarily have to be on your turn, but it can be at the end of another creature's turn. Casting the spell stored does not spend a spell slot. Once you cast the spell stored in the matrix, this spell ends.

A {@spell dispel magic|PHb} spell that successfully dispels the matrix also dispels the spell stored inside of it. When placed inside an {@spell antimagic field|PHB}, the duration of the spell is paused, but not ended, and it becomes active again once you exit the field.

spell.name: Simbul's Spell Sequencer

components.m: a sapphire worth at least 1,000 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You prepare a magical matrix that allows you to store up to two of your spells and activate them at a later time within the spell's duration, without requiring an action.

In the next two rounds after you cast this spell, you can cast a spell of 3rd level or lower to place in the matrix, spending a spell slot and components for that spell as usual. You can only store a spell that has a casting time of 1 action. Placing a spell into the matrix does {@damage 1d6} force damage to you, which cannot be reduced in any way while the spell is active. You can store a maximum of two spells in the matrix.

For the spell's duration, you can cast the spell placed in the matrix as a free action. This casting does not necessarily have to be on your turn, but it can be at the end of another creature's turn. Casting the spell stored does not spend a new spell slot. Once you cast one of the spells stored in the matrix, this spell ends.

In addition, if both of the spells in the matrix are of 2nd level or lower, you can create a spell sequence out of the two stored spells. The two spells in a spell sequence can both be cast at the exact same time as a single free action. This casting does not necessarily have to be on your turn, but it can be at the end of another creature's turn. Casting the two spells as a spell sequence does not spend any new spell slots. Once you do this, this spell ends.

A {@spell dispel magic|PHB} spell that successfully dispels the matrix also dispels the spell stored inside of it. When placed inside an {@spell antimagic field|PHB}, the duration of the spell is paused, but not ended, and it becomes active again once you exit the field.

spell.name: Simbul's Spell Trigger

components.m: a diamond worth at least 1,500 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You prepare a magical matrix that allows you to store up to two of your spells and cast them at any time you choose, without requiring an action.

In the next three rounds after you cast this spell, you can then cast a spell of 3rd level or lower to place in the matrix, using a spell slot and components for that spell as usual. You can only store a spell that has a casting time of 1 action. Placing a spell into the matrix does {@damage 1d6} force damage to you, which cannot be reduced in any way while the spell is active. You can store a maximum of three spells in the matrix.

For the spell's duration, you can cast the spell placed in the matrix as a free action. This casting does not necessarily have to be on your turn, but it can be at the end of another creature's turn. Casting the spell stored does not spend a spell slot. Once you cast the spell stored in the matrix, this spell ends.

In addition, if two or more of the spells in the matrix are of 2nd level or lower, you can create a spell sequence out of the two or three stored spells. If a group of spells are in a spell sequence, you can cast them all at the exact same time as a single free action. This casting does not necessarily have to be on your turn, but it can be at the end of another creature's turn. Casting the spells as a spell sequence does not spend a spell slot. Once you do this, this spell ends.

You can also specify a condition or event that will cause a spell or a spell sequence to take effect as per the {@spell contingency|PHB} spell when you cast this spell. For example, you could create a spell sequence with the spells {@spell water breathing|PHB} and {@spell blur|PHB}, and specify that whenever you are engulfed in water or a similar liquid, the spell sequence takes effect.
The contingent spell takes effect immediately after the circumstance is met for the first time, whether or not you want it to, and then {@i Simbul's spell trigger ends}.

The contingent spell takes effect only on you, even if it can normally target others. You can use only one {@spell contingency|PHB} spell at a time. If you cast this spell again, the effect of another {@spell contingency|PHB} spell on you ends.

A {@spell dispel magic|PHB} spell that successfully dispels the matrix also dispels the spell stored inside of it. When placed inside an {@spell antimagic field|PHB}, the duration of the spell is paused, but not ended, and it becomes active again once you exit the field.

spell.name: Simbul's Synostodweomer
entries: You channel the casting of a spell not into a magical effect, but instead transform it into positive healing energy. After you cast this spell, you can use an action to expend a spell slot (without casting a spell). You may then, in the same action, touch a willing creature and have it regain hit points equal to {@dice 1d12} per level of the spell slot you expended.

spell.name: Sinsabur's Baleful Bolt
entries: A dark beam of necromantic wilting energy lashes out from you in a line 60 feet long and 10 feet wide. Each creature in the line must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 3d10} necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Creatures who fail the save also have their hit point maximum reduced for 1 hour by the damage it took. In addition, for 1 hour the target's Strength score is reduced by {@dice 1d4 + 1}, or until it is removed with {@spell lesser restoration|PHB} or similar magic.

spell.name: Skeletal Guard

components.m: one finger bone and one onyx worth at least 50 gp for each skeleton to be created, which the spell consumes

entries: You create an army of loyal skeletons from finger bones that you touch. You can create up to fifteen skeletons, which have the statistics of skeletons in the Monster Manual, except with the maximum possible value of hit points and wearing chain shirt armor. The skeletons also have advantage on saving throws against features that turn undead.

All the skeletons are loyal to you and treat you as their leader, and will follow any orders you or your allies give to them. They also can perform simple tasks such as scouting out terrain, doing menial work, or fighting alongside you and your companions.

On each of your turns, you can use a bonus action to mentally command one or more of the skeletons you made with this spell if the skeleton is within your line of sight. You decide what action the skeleton will take and where it will move during its next turn, or you can issue a general command, such as to guard a particular chamber or corridor. If you issue no commands, the skeleton will attempt to protect you. Once given an order, the creature continues to follow it until its task is complete.
The skeleton's last until they are all destroyed or you use an action to instantly dismiss the spell and reduce all skeletons to a pile of bones.
Skeletons created by this spell cannot be controlled or taken over command by another creature.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a slot of 9th level, you can create up to twenty skeletons with this spell, rather than fifteen.

spell.name: Snilloc's Snowball

components.m: a small bit of ivory

entries: You create three orbs of icy cold in your space. They float in the air and orbit you for the duration. When you cast the spell and as a bonus action on each of your turns thereafter you can throw one of the orbs, sending them streaking towards a target you choose within 120 feet of you. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d6} cold damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you create one additional orb for every two slot levels above 1st.

spell.name: Soul Scour

components.m: dust from the bones of a lich's body

entries: Your touch corrupts a creature's very soul and damages their mental characteristics. Make a melee spell attack. On a hit, you attempt to warp their mind and soul. At the beginning of the creature's next turn, the target must make a Wisdom saving throw and a Charisma saving throw. If it fails the Wisdom saving throw, its Wisdom score is reduced by {@dice 1d4 + 1}. If it fails the Charisma saving throw, its Charisma score is reduced by {@dice 2d4}. If either of these scores becomes 0, the creature dies.
These ability score reductions last for one hour, unless they are cured through {@spell lesser restoration|PHB} or similar magic.

spell.name: Sphere of Ultimate Destruction

components.m: a pinch of dust from a creature that has been disintegrated

entries: A 5-foot diameter sphere of pure void and annihilation appears in an unoccupied space of your choice within range and lasts for the duration. Any creature that ends its turn within 5 feet of the sphere must make a Dexterity saving throw. The creature takes {@damage 10d6 + 40} force damage on a failed save, or {@damage 5d6} force damage on a successful one.

As an action, you can move the sphere up to 60 feet. If you ram the sphere into a creature, that creature must make the saving throw against the sphere's damage, and the sphere stops moving this turn.

When you move the sphere, you can direct it over barriers up to 5 feet tall and jump it across pits up to 10 feet wide. The sphere emits a gentle circulating breeze around it as surrounding air is sucked in.

Damage from this spell that reduces a creature to 0 hit points disintegrates that creature. A disintegrated creature and everything it is wearing and carrying, except magic items, are reduced to a pile of fine gray dust. The creature can be restored to life only by means of a true resurrection or a wish spell.

A Large or smaller nonmagical object or a creation of magical force that comes into contact with the sphere is disintegrated. If the sphere comes into contact with a Huge or larger object or creation of force, this spell disintegrates a 10-foot-cube portion of it. A magic item is unaffected by this spell.

spell.name: Superior Darkvision

components.m: either a pinch of dried carrot or an agate

entries: You touch a willing creature to grant it the ability to see perfectly in darkness. For the duration, that creature has darkvision without any limit to its radius and can see in magical darkness created by a spell of 3rd level or lower.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, a creature under the effect of this spell can see through magical darkness created by a spell less than the spell slot you used.

spell.name: Undead Lieutenant
entries: You attempt to empower an intelligent undead (Intelligence 5 or greater) with the ability to command other undead in your control. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw if it is unwilling. On a failure, the spell takes effect.

Other undead under your control obey the subject intelligent undead as if it were you. You may still give orders to the undead normally, superseding the orders of the subject of the spell. Once the spell ends, the intelligent undead is aware that it has been used in this way.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the maximum duration for this spell increases by 10 minutes for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Watchware

components.m: a sprinkling of rare sands and powdered reagents worth at least 500 gp

entries: You touch a single object and create a mystical connection with it. After you cast this spell, if the object is damaged, destroyed, moved, or touched at any later time, you instantly are aware of this fact. If another creature touches this object, you receive a mental image of the creature and the area within 60 feet of the object. This mental image sees through darkness, including magical darkness, and can see through illusions or other false effects. This image also counts as firsthand knowledge if you cast scrying on the creature that disturbed the object.

You receive the mental alert if the item is disturbed for any reason, including if it is handled or touched with a long metal pole, a cat walks on it, or an earthquake knocks it over. You can also designate a verbal password that allows a creature to handle the object without sounding the mental alert. After being activated, the spell immediately ends on the object. Because of its costly material components, many wizards and sorcerers use this spell to safeguard valuable, rare items.
A {@i watchware} spell counts as a magical trap for the purposes of spells, features, and effects.
